member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.BarcodeReader.CheckForData
member.summary: This is the worker thread that retrieves the messages in a loop. The worker thread P/Invokes into unmanaged code to ITCSCAN_GetBarcodeMessage. This method will be blocked until new (asynchronous) data is available. If data is available and if we have a listener (event handler), we pass the data on. Note that CheckForData remains active (in combination with the unmanaged DLL), even if there are no listeners for data.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.DocumentCapture
member.summary: Provides interface to display the document image. It allows users to make the document capture settings.
member.remarks:
This class provides settings to allow edge detection of a document, and capture to a file with the following features.
Keystone effect removal
Auto Rotation to align document vertically
Document detection by contrast evaluation

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning
member.summary: Common helper class for setting properties and filters for images created by Intermec imagers.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ImageConditioningVersion(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows determining if Image Conditioning is available on this device and build, and what the version it is.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ImageConditioningAvailable
member.summary: Allows determining if Image Conditioning is available on this device and build.
member.returns: true if Image Conditioning is available on this device and build combination.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ContrastEnhancement
member.summary: Enables filter that automatically adjusts brightness and contrast based on a grey level histogram.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ImageRotation
member.summary: Rotates picture clockwise in 90 degree increments.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.Subsampling
member.summary: reduces image size and therefore transfer time, by averaging sets of pixels into one new pixel.
member.remarks: includes horizontal and vertical grouping, so 1 of 2 would be 1/4 the as large as none. 1 of 8 = 1/64th etc.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.NoiseReduction
member.summary:
This property allows control of a low pass filter that can remove image noise.
The range is 0 to 9.
member.remarks: Filtering may add some blur. 0 is no noise reduction. Values outside of this range will be limited to the edges of the range.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ImageLightingCorrection
member.summary: Causes use of a filter that attempts to adjust for inconsistent lighting across an image or document.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.Brightness
member.summary: Modifies the default brightness of the image range is -100 to +100.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorMode
member.summary: Selects either Grayscale (default) or Black/White images.
member.remarks:
Black and white are commonly used for images containing text. The resulting image will be clearer and use less memory. Use ColorModeValue parameters to adjust the binarisation threshold. Normally used for pictures of text.
Monochrome choices only really work with TIFF. Monochrome_Enhanced_TIFF_Quality causes an algorithm that doubles the file size but generally produces a higher quality image.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeBrightnessThreshold
member.summary: Only applies to TIFF, determines threshold of conversion VeryDark means light gray is converted to black.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.OutputCompression
member.summary: Determines method of compression, JPEG is variable, TIFF converts to black and white, and BMP is uncompressed raw.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.OutputCompressionQuality
member.summary: For JPEG only determines file compression 0 being most compressed, lowest quality. 100 = highest quality 0 compression.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.TextEnhancementValue
member.summary: Designed to make textual content more readable. It can however increase the noise level.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue
member.summary: Values to allow reducing size and transfer time of image by taking a filtered version where pixels removed

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.None
member.summary: Full content no subsampling

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfTwo
member.summary: Returns image of every 2x2 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfThree
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 3x3 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfFour
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 4x4 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfFive
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 5x5 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfSix
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 6x6 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfSeven
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 7x7 square of pixels

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.SubsamplingValue.OneOfEight
member.summary: Returns image of one pixel for every 8x8 square of pixels

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeValue
member.summary: Allows converting images from gray scale to black and white.
member.remarks: Commonly used for images containing text. The converted image (any value except None) will be clearer and use less memory.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeValue.None
member.summary: Gray scale, 8 bit/pixel use with BMP or JPEG files.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeValue.Monochrome_Normal
member.summary: Black and white, 1 bit/pixel use with TIFF files.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.ImageConditioning.ColorModeValue.Monochrome_Enhanced_TIFF_Quality
member.summary: Black and white, 1 bit/pixel use with TIFF files, but interpolated to appear to have twice the pixel density.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager
member.summary: Supports using imager as a simple camera (video streaming and snap shots). (Intermec computers with Imager only)
member.remarks:
If your Intermec computer is equipped with an Imager, the Intermec.DataCollection.Imager class allows you to control selected Imager functions. Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.
Usage requires itcImager.dll which can be loaded directly, or installed by DC_NET.CAB

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.SnapShotConditioning
member.summary: Provides an instance of the ImageConditioning class for setting conditioning for SnapShots.
member.remarks:
With certain versions of CN3 and later Intermec Computers, additional control is provided that also supports putting different settings on SnapShots than the normal Imaging (streaming video). This object is used to set those properties for snap shots. In order to support legacy applications, some parameters that are passed into the snapshot function are used to set the appropriate SnapShot image conditioning properties.
This field points to an object of the class ImageConditioning that allows setting those properties for snap shots.
The Imager class property ImageConditioningAvailable can be used to determine if the current device has image conditioning support.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.ImageConditioning
member.summary: Provides an instance of the ImageConditioning class for setting conditioning for streaming video.
member.remarks:
With certain versions of CN3 and later Intermec Computers, additional control is provided over image quality. Different settings for normal Imaging (streaming video) as opposed to snapshots is also supported. The object pointed to by this field is used to set the streaming video properties.
The Imager class property ImageConditioningAvailable can be used to determine if the current device has image conditioning support. The following properties are overwritten in this object.
PropertyComments
OutputCompressionValue: This property defines if the image is compressed when moving from the imager to the computer. This choice is made by the software based on the Imager type, and its ability for high speed transfer.
OutputCompressionQuality: Assuming that speed is more important than image quality for streaming video on the small screen, if JPEG compression is used to transfer the image, the quality is set to 50%
Subsampling: For speed, is always set to OneOfEight for imaging.

Set to resolution NOTE: this overrides image conditioning subsampling parameter.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.SnapShot(System.String,Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.PictureResolutionSize,Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.FileModeType)
member.summary: Saves Image to a file, and allows setting resolution and compression type.
member.param: Full path and filename on the device.
subsamples to pass fewer pixels for speed. NOTE: This overrides image conditioning sub sampling parameter.
Compression type of the file. As in JPEG, BMP, or TIFF.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.VideoRunning
member.summary: Enables streaming video to the Imager pictureBox
member.remarks:
true = Video is streamed to the pictureBox.
false = (Default) Video is not streamed.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.ImageConditioningAvailable
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether the conditioning objects SnapShotConditioning and ImageConditioning are available on this device.
member.remarks:
Only certain devices such as the CN4 or CN50 having the EA21 imager support Image Conditioning which provides advanced settings to improve image quality. Since this can only be determined at runtime, code that uses the conditioning class properties should check this property to determine availability.
The SnapShotConditioning and ImageConditioning object pointers will be null if the conditioning functionality is not available on the device the application is running on.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.EnhanceContrast
member.summary: Enables a photo enhancement algorithm. Superceeded by ImageConditioning.ContrastEnhancement
member.remarks: If Image conditioning is available, using ContrastEnhancement will provide more options than this one. If this property is set, it will modify ContrastEnhancement values if they were set.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.FlipPicture
member.summary: Flips the picture upside down. If Image Conditioning is available, Rotation can be used and provides more options.
member.remarks: Image flip is applied after the Image Conditioning Rotation, so generaly they should not both be used.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.Brightness
member.summary: Changes the Brightness of the image. Applies to streaming video and SnapShots. Image Conditioning brightness can be applied to each seperately but both Image Condition settings will be overwritten by this property.
member.remarks:
In order to have code written for devices that did not have image conditioning work with the image conditioning enabled devices, some legacy properties such as this one have been modified to set the equivelant value in the ImageConditioning object. The difference in range and offset of the values is accounted for in the conversion.
If the Image Conditioning brightness properties are, used this property should not be set.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.MirrorPicture
member.summary: Flips the image along the vertical access.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.OnScreenInfo
member.summary: For debug, turns on a display of information about the quality and speed of presentation of an image. Not shown in snapshot.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.OnScreenDateTime
member.summary: Identifies where the date and time is displayed on the screen, and inserted in the snapshot.
member.remarks: NOTE: Not supported for TIFF files.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection.Imager.OnScreenCaptionPosition

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection.ImagerException

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection.ImagerException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Select the mode for the current scenario. When active, two modes are available. With the first one, the area to capture is defined by settings relative to the size and position of the barcode label. The second one use specific patterns to determine the area to capture. When one of these two mode is enabled, a barcode read will trigger the current signature capture scenario if the barcode identifier, barcode length and barcode mask conditions are satisfied.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Select the barcode identifier which triggers the signature capture scenario. If null, this condition will be satisfied whatever the barcode identifier read. Up to now, only these symbologies are supported: EAN/UPC, ITF, Code128/EAN128, Code 93, PDF417, Datamatix, Code QR, Maxicode.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Horizontal offset from the center of the barcode to the center of the area to capture. This value may be negative (encoded in two’s complement). This setting is useless with the framing patterns mode.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Vertical offset from the center of the barcode to the center of the area to capture. This value may be negative (encoded in two’s complement). This setting is useless with the framing patterns mode.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This setting forces the capture image to have enough pixels compared to the source image. In other words, it limits the usable depth of field. More this value is high (0 to 100%), more the depth of field is limited. A value of 50% means that the area to capture must be higher or equal the half of the image (in pixels number).
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
When disabled, there is no projective mapping, and the system returns the smallest rectangle image which contains the area to capture. When set to automatic, the projective mapping is active, and the resolution used is automatically adjusted. A fixed resolution is useful to have always the same size for the captured area. When using a fixed resolution, if the captured image is bigger than the original image, an Signature capture failure event is sent with the “Invalid parameters” failure code.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This setting enables the binarization of the captured image using an adaptive threshold (white and black only). The Binary process is performed after the contrast enhancement, filtering and edge enhancement processes.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This setting allows to decrease the image size with a configurable quality setting. When the JPEG compression is used, the output buffer is a JFIF byte stream which can be directly stored on hard drive and can be read by any JPEG reader.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Also know as “Sharpening”, this setting allows the enhancement of the edges of the object in the image. It may enhance the readability of text reading. The edge enhancement process is performed after the filtering process.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This setting may be useful to reduce the noise resulting from the edge enhancement process. If set to 0, this filtering stage is disabled. Higher is the setting, higher is the filter. The filtering process is performed after the contrast enhancement process.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
